item.description: Setup your timezone.
Synchronize systemtime using transponder or internet.
Configure your NTP server.
Setup network time synchronization interval.
Choose which level of menu/setting's to display. 'Expert'-level shows all items.
When enabled, teletext pages will be cached, allowing faster access.
12V output.
Configure which tuner type will be preferred, when the same service is available on different types of tuners.

Enable remote enigma2 receiver to be tried to tune into services that cannot be tuned into locally (e.g. tuner is occupied or service type is unavailable on the local tuner. Specify complete URL including http:// and port number (normally ...:8001), e.g. http://second_box:8001.
URL of fallback remote receiver
Configure which tuner will be preferred, when more than one tuner is available. If set to 'auto' the system will give priority to the tuner having the lowest number of channels/satellites.

Configure which tuner will be preferred for recordings, when more than one tuner is available. 'Disabled' would select a tuner based on preferred tuner in customise screen. 'Auto' would choose based on E2's default rules, ignoring preferred tuner in customise screen.
When tuned to a service the system will normally scan the transponder for any changes and save them. Only set to 'yes' if you're absolutely sure what you're doing.
ECM data will be included in the stream. This enables a client receiver to decode it.
Enables a feature so that the receiver can decrypt streams (if the ECM data is included in the stream and a valid card is available).
Select what should be done when the %s %s was shutdown incorrectly, or after the Power was lost.
Select what should be done when the %s %s was boot-up, normal playing or goto standby.
When enabled, authentication is required to watch http streams.
Set the time to hide the infobar.
Enable and set the duration of the second infobar (press OK twice) that may include more information on the current service.
Set the time to hide the second infobar. The bar also disappears on pressing 'OK'.
Option to disable picons on the Infobar
Set the screen type you get on pressing 'OK' when the info bar shows to 2nd infobar Lite or event info.
Fade the Infobar on hide
Control the Infobar fading speed
Select how to activate the Quick EPG mode:
Show spinning logo when system is busy.
With this option you can hide Job Tasks from the extension screen (short blue button press).
Choose whether or not to show an icon when a motorized dish is moving.
Use the alternative or the conventional radio mode.

item.text: Position of finished Timers in Timerlist
item.description: Control of the position how finished timer are shown in the Timer List.
If set to 'yes' the infobar will be displayed when changing channels.
If set to 'yes; the infobar will be displayed when Fast Forwarding or Rewinding during media playback.
If set to 'yes' the infobar will be displayed when a new event starts.
If set to 'yes' the channel number will be displayed in the infobar.
This option allows you choose the background colour of transparent picons.
Show background when tuned to a radio channel.
Configure the duration in minutes for the screensaver.
This option allows you choose how to display remaining time, or elapsed time, or both.
This option allows you choose how to display elapsed time as + or -
This option allows you choose how to display the remaining/elapsed time for live tv.
This option allows you choose how to display the remaining/elapsed time for media playback.
Hide any zap error messages.
Hide error messages from the Common Interface module.
Show encryption info in the infobar (when supported by the skin).
Configure the source of the frontend data as shown on the infobars. 'Settings' is as stored on the settings. 'Tuner' is as reported by the tuner.

item.text: Swap SNR in '%' with SNR in 'db'
item.description: This option allows you to the SNR as a percentage (not all receivers support this).
Choose what you want the button '0' to do when PIP is active.
This option allows you to disable sorting of the option in setting screen's
This option allows you to disable sorting of the menus
This option allows you to disable sorting of the plugin browser.
This option allows you to disable sorting of the Extensions list.

item.text: Show Restart Network in Extensions list *
item.description: This option allows you to disable show Restart Network in Extensions list.

item.text: Show PVR status in MoviePlayer infobar
item.description: This option moves the PVR status from the seprate window into the MoviePlayer infobar.
When enabled the PiP can be closed by the exit button.

item.text: Show VCR scart on main menu
item.description: When enabled, the VCR scart option will be shown on the main menu
When enabled, channel numbering will start at '1' for each bouquet.
With this option set to 'yes' the channel lists will always show you the bouquet screen first. If set to 'no' the current bouquet will be opened.
When enabled, continue to the next bouquet when the last channel of the current bouquet is reached while changing channels.

If set to 'yes' you can preview channels in the channel list. Press 'OK' to preview the selected channel, press a 2nd 'OK' to exit and zap to that channel, pressing 'EXIT' to return to the channel you started at.
This option allows you to choose from the two channel lists that are available.
If set to 'yes' the channel list will be shown after switching between radio and TV modes.

Configure the cursor behaviour in the channel selection list. When opening the channel selection list you can keep on the current service or already select up/down and you are able to revert the B+/B- buttons.
Services may be grouped in bouquets. When enabled, you can use more then one bouquet.
When enabled, pressing '0' will zap you to the first channel in your first bouquet and delete your zap-history.

item.text: Jump first press in channel selection
item.description: This option allows you to choose what the first button press jumps to in channel list screen, (so pressing '2' jumps to 'A' or '2' first), when 'Quick Actions' preset actions are performed.
Set the type of the progress indication in the channel selection screen.
Configure if and how wide columns will be shown in the channel selection list.

item.text: Show channel numbers in channel selection
item.description: When enabled, show channel numbers in the channel selection screen.
Configure if and how crypto icons will be shown in the channel selection list.
Configure if and how service type icons will be shown.
Configure if and how the record indicator will be shown in the channel selection list.
Configure if service picons will be shown in the servicelist.
This allows you change the number of rows shown.
This allows you change the font size relative to skin size, so 1 increases by 1 point size, and -1 decreases by 1 point size
This allows you change the font size relative to skin size, so 1 increases by 1 point size, and -1 decreases by 1 point size
This allows you change the font size relative to skin size, so 1 increases by 1 point size, and -1 decreases by 1 point size
Setup how to control the channel changing.
Choose the location where the EPG data will be stored when the %s %s is shut down. The location must be available at boot time.
Choose the name of the file that holds the EPG data when the %s %s is shut down. This can be handy to differentiate between several boxes.
Allows the %s %s to read the stored EPG data regularly.
The %s %s reads the stored EPG data every (hours).
Configure if epg.dat should be saved at all.
Allows the %s %s to store the EPG data regularly.
The %s %s stores the EPG data every (hours).
Display the EIT now/next eventdata in infobar.
Use EIT EPG information when it is available.
Use MHW EPG information when it is available.
Use FreeSat EPG information when it is available.
Use ViaSat EPG information when it is available.
Use Netmed EPG information when it is available.
Use Virgin EPG information when it is available.
Configure for how many minutes finished events should remain visible in the EPG. Useful when you need information about an event which has just finished, or has been delayed.
When enabled, EIT data will be included in http streams. This allows a client receiver to show EPG.
When enabled, AIT data will be included in http streams. This allows a client receiver to use HbbTV.
Configure the color of the teletext subtitles.
When enabled, teletext subtitles will be displayed at their original position.
When enabled, the original line breaks will be removed from the teletext subtitles.
Configure the vertical position of the subtitles, measured from the bottom of the screen.
Configure the horizontal alignment of the subtitles.
Configure the border width of the subtitles. The dark border makes the subtitles easier to read on a light background.
Configure the font size of the subtitles.
Configure the subtitle delay when timing information is not available.
When enabled, graphical DVB subtitles will be displayed in yellow, instead of the original color.
When enabled, graphical DVB subtitles will be displayed at their original position.
When enabled, graphical DVB subtitles will be centered horizontally.

item.text: Subtitle delay when timing is bad
item.description: Configure an additional delay to improve subtitle synchronisation.
Configure the transparency of the black background of graphical DVB subtitles.
Configure the color of the external subtitles, alternative (normal in white, italic in yellow, bold in cyan, underscore in green), white or yellow.
Configure an additional delay to improve external subtitle synchronisation.
Can be used for different fps between external subtitles and video.
Remove texts for the hearing impaired from external subtitles (instrumental music or environmental sounds, e.g., when a doorbell rings or a gun shot is heard).
When enabled, external subtitles will be always turned on for playback movie.
Configure the first audio language (highest priority).
Configure the second audio language.
Configure the third audio language.
Configure the fourth audio language.
When enabled, the receiver will select an AC3 track (when available).
When enabled, the receiver will select an AC3+ track (when available).

item.text: Prefer audio track stored by service
item.description: When enabled, the receiver will automatically use the audio track which you selected before.
Configure the first subtitle language (highest priority).
Configure the second subtitle language.
Configure the third subtitle language.
Configure the fourth subtitle language.

item.text: Allow subtitle language to equal audio language
item.description: Usually when the subtitle language is the same as the audio language, the subtitles will not be used. Enable this option to allow these subtitles to be used.
When enabled, subtitles for the hearing impaired can be used.
When enabled, subtitles for the hearing impaired will be preferred over normal subtitles, when both types are available.
When enabled, graphical DVB subtitles are preferred over teletext subtitles, when both types are available.
When enabled, the receiver will automatically use the subtitles which you selected before.
Configure the primary EPG language.
Configure the secondary EPG language.
Configure which tuner for recordings will be preferred, when more than one tuner is available.
When enabled, a recording is allowed to interrupt live tv, when there are no free tuners.
When nonzero, a recording will start earlier than the starting time indicated by the EPG.
When nonzero, a recording will stop later than the ending time indicated by the EPG.
When enabled, a popup message will be shown when a recording starts.
When enabled, the lenght of each recording will be shown in the movielist (this might cause some additional loading time).
Configure the type of status indication icons shown in the movielist.
When enabled, it is possible to leave the movieplayer with exit.

item.text: Behavior when a movie is started
item.description: Configure the behavior when movie playback is started.

item.text: Behavior when a movie is stopped
item.description: Configure the behavior when movie playback is manually stopped.

item.text: Behavior when a movie reaches the end
item.description: Configure the behavior when reaching the end of a movie, during movie playback.

item.text: Display message before playing next movie
item.description: When enabled, a popup message will be shown when a movie has finished and the next one will start.
Configure the behavior of the 'pause' key when movie playback is already paused.
Configure the skip time interval for the '1'/'3' buttons.
Configure the skip time interval for the '4'/'6' buttons.
Configure the skip time interval for the '7'/'9' buttons.
Select seekbar to be activated by arrow L/R (long) or << >> (long).
Set the jump-size of the seekbar.
Configure the possible fast forward speeds.
Configure the possible rewind speeds.
Configure the slow motion speeds.
Configure the initial fast forward speed. When you press the fast forward button, winding will start at this speed.
Configure the initial rewind speed. When you press the rewind button, winding will start at this speed.

item.text: Limit character set for recording filenames
item.description: Limit the characters that can be used in recording filenames to (7 bit) ascii. This ensures compatibility with operating systems or file systems with limited character sets.
Configure how recording filenames are constructed.
Configure the number of days old timers are kept before they are automatically removed from the timer list.
When enabled, deleted recordings are moved to the trash can, instead of being deleted immediately.

item.text: Remove items from trash can after (days)
item.description: Configure the number of days after which items are automaticaly removed from the trash can.
When enabled, network trash can's are probed for cleaning.

item.text: Disk space to reserve for recordings (in GB)
item.description: Configure the minimum amount of disk space to be available for recordings. When the amount of space drops below this value, deleted items will be removed from the trash can.
Configure on which devices the background delete option should be used.
Configure the speed of the background deletion process. Lower speed will consume less hard disk drive performance.
Configure the offline decoding delay in milliseconds. The configured delay is observed at each control word parity change.

Descramble & record ECM' gives the option to descramble afterwards if descrambling on recording failed. 'Don't descramble, record ECM' save a scramble recording that can be descrambled on playback. 'Normal' means descramble the recording and don't record ECM.
Configure the hard disk drive to go to standby after the specified idle time.
Option to enable the Hardware Standby Timer
When enabled, use DHCP for the IP configuration.
Configure the IP address.
Configure the netmask.
Configure the gateway.
Configure the nameserver (DNS).
Activate the configured network settings.
Shows live tv or informations on LCD.
Configure the brightness level of the front panel display for normal operation.
Configure the brightness level of the front panel display for standby.
Configure the contrast level of the front panel display.
LED brightness during normal operations.
LED brightness during standby.
LED brightness during deep standby.
Power LED state during deep-standby/standby.
If the text is too long to be displayed on the front panel, it will be repeated (number of times):
Set the scrolling speed of text on the front display.
Set the scrolling speed of text on the front display.
If the text is too long to be displayed on the front panel, it will be repeated (number of times):

item.text: Show MiniTV in the Front Display
item.description: You can Display MiniTV with or without OSD Menu

item.text: Show PIP in the Front Display
item.description: You can Display PIP with or without OSD Menu
Lower Framerate save CPU Time

item.text: Show blinking rec symbol on Display during recording
item.description: Enable blinking rec symbol on the LCD Display

item.text: Show blinking rec symbol on Display during recording
item.description: Enable blinking rec symbol on the LCD Display

item.text: Show blinking Clock on Display during recording
item.description: Enable blinking Clock on the LCD Display
Allows you to enable/disable displaying icons on the frontpanel.
This option allows you choose how to display remaining time, or elapsed time, or both.
This option allows you choose how to display the remaining/elapsed time for live tv.
This option allows you choose how to display the remaining/elapsed time for Media playback.
This option allows you choose how to display elapsed time as + or -
This option allows you to Power Off the display.
Show HDMI Output Resulution
Disable the HDD Process on VFD
Disable all VFD Symbols
Set the scrolling speed of text on the front display, this is used by software renderer in some skins.
Set the delay time between repeated loops, this is used by software renderer in some skins.

item.text: Use work-around for recordings from deep-standby
item.description: Check if there is a recording started in the next 5 mins (at bootup), then put your box in standby.

item.text: Use time jumps for fast forward/backward
item.description: This will go fast forward/backward with time frames of x secs
Choose which tuner to configure.
Configure the tuner mode.
Configure the DiSEqC mode for this LNB.
Configure the longitude of your location.
Configure the latitude of your location.
When enabled, measure power consumption to detect when the rotor stops turning (when supported by the tuner).
Perform an online update check in the background
Setup the interval to check for online updates. (in hours)
When enabled the online checker will also check for experimental versions
Perform a setting backup before updating.
Perform a image backup before updating.
Configure the function of a long press on the power button.
Configure the function of a short press on the power button.
Select what you want the EPG button to activate:
Select what you want the INFO button to activate:
Select what you want the OK button to activate:
Select if you want the Subservice mode to be activated.
Select how to activate the Quick EPG mode:
Select what you want the TV button to activate:
Configure the function of the < > buttons.
Select what you want the Channel +/- button to activate:
Select what you want the Up/Down button to activate:
Select what you want the RED button to activate:
Select what you want the RED-Long button to activate:
Select what you want the YELLOW button to activate:
Select what you want the YELLOW-Long button to activate:
Switch Blue-Short (QuickMenu) with Blue-Long (Extensions)
Allows you to show/hide CCcam in extensions (blue button).
Allows you to show/hide OScam in extensions (blue button).
Choose the location for crash and debuglogs.
Allows more detailed to be in the crash log
Allows you to enable the debug log. They contain very detailed information of everything the system does.
Allows you to set the maximum size of the Debug log size (MB). When that size is reached, a new file will be created.

item.text: Show Log Manager in extensions list ?
item.description: Allows you to show/hide Log Manager in extensions (blue button).
Logs older then the set no of days will be deleted.
If logs are using the set maximum space used the eldest will be deleted.
If set to 'yes', enable autorecord for automatically background timeshift
When enabled, timeshift starts automatically in background after specified time.

item.text: Show warning when timeshift is stopped
item.description: When enabled, a warning will be displayed and the user will get an option to stop or to continue the timeshift.
Select if timeshift must continue when set to record.
Stop's timeshift being used if a recording is in progress. (adviseable for usb sticks)
If set to 'yes', allows you use the seekbar to jump to a point within the event.
Older files in the timeshift directory are removed on every event change.

item.text: Timeshift last events limit [number of events]
item.description: 'Buffer in hours' or 'number of last events'. For deleting older timeshift files, the condition which occurred first has priority.

item.text: Timeshift checking for older files [in minutes]
item.description: In addition to the check at an event start, a repetitive check can be used, so that the conditions 'buffer limit in hours' or 'check free space' are detected earlier.
If the free space is less than 1024 MB, then an attempt is made to delete the old timeshift files.
If set to 'no', can you save older events even after zapping or interruption of the timeshift.

item.text: Show DVD-Player in Mainmenu when BMC is installed ?
item.description: Show DVD-Player in Mainmenu
If set to 'yes' it will show the 'PO' packages in browser.
If set to 'yes' it will show the 'SRC' packages in browser.
